definition: a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.chinese: 我们为我们的胜利而欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: A young men and women and rejoice, bundles bright-coloured rose itch to try.
sentences.chinese: 一个个年轻男女欢欣鼓舞，一束束鲜艳玫瑰跃跃欲试。

sentences.english: He exulted in his younger sister's success.
sentences.chinese: 他为妹妹的成功而欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: The ball fans rejoiced over the news of their team's victory.
sentences.chinese: 这些球迷听到他们球队胜利的消息而欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: The day Bunkie was fired there was great rejoicing and much drinking of champagne.
sentences.chinese: 邦奇被解雇的那天，大家欢欣鼓舞，痛饮香槟。

sentences.english: Few people would not exult at the abolition of slavery.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶制被废除了，人们无不为之欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: The young actress gloried in her unexpected success.
sentences.chinese: 年轻演员为意想不到的成功而欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: When the good news reached Lankao, the whole country rejoiced.
sentences.chinese: 喜讯传到兰考，全县人民都欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: Some future goal can always let us dance with joy.
sentences.chinese: 有一个未来悳目标总能让我们欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: On the economy, Americans aren't euphoric, but the mood is clearly improving.
sentences.chinese: 对于经济，美国人没有欢欣鼓舞，不过情绪明显好转。

sentences.english: The yen's strength causes little jubilation in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日圆走强并没给日本带来欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: They listened exultantly to the sounds from outside.
sentences.chinese: 她们欢欣鼓舞地倾听着外面的声音。

sentences.english: Go forth rejoicing in the power and the peace of the One.
sentences.chinese: 向前去吧，在太一的大能与和平中欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: We fill with exultation in the new victory.
sentences.chinese: 我们在新的胜利中欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: Go forth rejoicing in the power and the peace of the one Creator.
sentences.chinese: 向前去吧，在太一的大能与和平中欢欣鼓舞。

definition: to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
lit. to flick dust off sb's cap (idiom); to celebrate an official appointment/to congratulate and celebrate (promotion, graduation etc)
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
the entire nation/the whole country, from the leadership to the rank and file
to line the streets in welcome
